What is the purpose of the OPTION_GATEWAY flag when defining a currency?
The OPTION_GATEWAY flag, set to 128, allows the currency to route external currencies. This is typically used for PBaaS chains or gateways.

// if set, this is a token, not a native currency OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID ```
./raw_txt_input/release_notes.md
What does the OPTION_PBAAS flag indicate about a currency definition?
The OPTION_PBAAS flag, set to 256, indicates that the currency definition is a PBaaS chain definition.

// if set, this is a token, not a native currency OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID ```
./raw_txt_input/release_notes.md
What is the purpose of the OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER flag?
The OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER flag, set to 512, indicates that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices.

// if set, this is a token, not a native currency OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID ```
./raw_txt_input/release_notes.md
What does the OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER flag control?
The OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER flag, set to 1024, controls where top-level ID and currency registration happen. When this flag is not set on a gateway, registration occurs on the launch chain.

// if set, this is a token, not a native currency OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID ```
./raw_txt_input/release_notes.md
What is the purpose of the OPTION_NFT_TOKEN flag?
The OPTION_NFT_TOKEN flag, set to 2048, allows for the creation of a single satoshi NFT token, which tokenizes control over the root ID.

// if set, this is a token, not a native currency OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID ```
./raw_txt_input/release_notes.md
